All for $6.00 a month a $.o2 a minute pay as I go. Compare that to the cost of a smartphone with data package! So saying, a mini will fit in my pocket as a large smartphone and serve all my needs on the road... IN MY POCKET...iPads are truly "swiss army knife" devices if you get the apps and set them up right. Most don't understand all the things an iPad can do.

Reviews.Title: Hat loves air.
Reviews.Author: Hat
Reviews.Content: GreatVery good product.I bought it for my wife and she is enjoying it very much. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Heneghan
Reviews.Content: Everything so far is just peachy keen new at this high tech stuff would recommend product LEARNING MORE EVERY DAY

Reviews.Title: OMG LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Danielle Parks
Reviews.Content: This thing is unreal! so slick and sparkly!!! lol I love my new ipad air! it even has siri!! so rad!! ships fast too!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Rodney Castro
Reviews.Content: I have never owned an ipad before but I really did my research to make sure if I really wanted the latest opacity or would I do with a cheaper older ipad.  The truth is this device is amazing!  When multitasking between games and browser and music this thing flies and I don't even notice any lags! Also the screen is so clear and high def thanks to its retina screen I believe? The ipad air responds to my every touch and swipe with ease and I'm only beginning to learn its many uses!  As a first time buyer who is price conscious,  I will say. This was the best purchase decision I made because for the price I spent,  I got a high performance ipad that beats all others with ease and with all its new features and compatibility with new and upcoming tech, I'm somewhat ready for it too! Other than all that. The ipad air is worth its price even if you are worried about price I say save the extra hundred dollars for this guy

Reviews.Title: It's nice
Reviews.Author: De cheng
Reviews.Content: I buy it for my friend, and she said it was very beautiful and love it so much, but it a little expensive

Reviews.Title: Convenient
Reviews.Author: Rachel Griffin
Reviews.Content: I like my Apple iPad Air.  This is my first iPad.  I enjoy the light weight convenience of being able to have it handy when I want to see or show how to craft video to my Mom and friends in other areas of my house.

Reviews.Title: IPad Air !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Alex Godino
Reviews.Content: Best tablet on the market right now ! And Great battery life ! Since Started using this ipad I don't use my computer anymore . So impressed !

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Kiki
Reviews.Content: Admittedly this is my first tablet, but so far it works great. I couldn't even tell it had been previously used.

Reviews.Title: Apple IPad Air
Reviews.Author: Nina M. Wolfson
Reviews.Content: It does everything I want it to do and then some.  It is small enough to carry comfortably and yet large enough to read.

Reviews.Title: Ipad
Reviews.Author: Ray Bencar
Reviews.Content: This is my first Ipad and I love it! I purchased it with WI-FI only and have it hot spotted with my Iphone. All the food groups with a lower cost!

Reviews.Title: Awesome !!!!
Reviews.Author: Castillod70
Reviews.Content: Great deal and super fast shipping, great customer service. But before purchasing ask if your iPad is able to get apple care plus on it. I was not able to because it was more than 30 days out. But still has most of the year of the standard apple care.

Reviews.Title: i pad air
Reviews.Author: David Morris
Reviews.Content: it has exceeded our expectations in performance and usability. both my wife and I have been using it on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: I Pad Air
Reviews.Author: Bea Perez "Beatrice Perez"
Reviews.Content: The I Pad Air is so light that it feels like I'm not holding anything. It works great & the pictures are beautiful I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Rick Currie
Reviews.Content: Takes a few days for it to arrive but there was no rush for me.  Will certainly enjoy using it.

Reviews.Title: A huge step when comparing a generation 1 ipad and the iPad air
Reviews.Author: Chastity
Reviews.Content: I have used a generation 1 ipad for a year now and, I was excited when I first started using it. Even though it didn't have a front or back camera. I didn't mind.It's pretty heavy so, i just layed it down on a tablemost of the time. It was all fun and games, until the ios7 update came out a few months ago. After the new update,I could barely do anything on it. All of my favorite apps were no longer useable and, I had to delete them all because theyrequired the new update. After ios7, the first gen ipad suddenly became useless and, I felt cheated out on the amount ofmoney that was spent on that ipad. I'm very surprised that the ipad 1 only costs 200 hundred dollars less than the new one.Even though generation one is a discontinued model. In my opinion, it should be off the market completely. Why bothergetting this outdated device, when you can buy the newest one for $200 more? The ipad air has a completely different feel to it. It's a hundred times lighter.The iPad air has so much new things like Siri. Some people may think asking a electronic device to do something for you might be a bit lazy but, you can make a reminder within 5 seconds without leaving your current app. Siri has better results when searching for something specific. It's also helpful if you're slow at texting or, if your hands are full. Browsing the web is a lot faster but, downloading an app may take a while depending on your Internet connection. Since ios7 is an high definition upgrade.

Reviews.Title: First choice for a tablet a real winner
Reviews.Author: C. Donnelly
Reviews.Content: I'm not trying to gush, but wanted to say that I waited and bided my time before breaking down and buying a tablet, and I'm really glad that this was the one that got my feet wet!  My main reason for getting one was that I was tired of dragging a cumbersome laptop (ha! laptops are now cumbersome!) when I traveled and needed to work.  This is lighweight, efficient, and has changed the way I can work while away from the office.  And while the cellular service added greatly to the purchase price, I prefer not having to rely solely on Wifi should it not be available.

Reviews.Title: Love my iPad
Reviews.Author: Wub
Reviews.Content: I thought I could live without an iPad, but it is so light and convenient.  It does everything!  I have to hide it from my grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Awesome iPad
Reviews.Author: Chris Foste
Reviews.Content: I bought the iPad for traveling purposes and haven't regretted it.  Does everything a computer would do and then some.  Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Everything I thought it would be
Reviews.Author: Don DiFiore
Reviews.Content: All apps synced perfect. All my Apple products work exactly as advertised, across the board through the cloud.  Worth the money difference if you use Apple products.

Reviews.Title: Apple delivers
Reviews.Author: Hershey Ogden
Reviews.Content: The iPad has never had any problems, does what it is supposed to and continues to build on the features of iPads past.

Reviews.Title: None Better
Reviews.Author: Cherie J. Hepburn
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually received this one as yet but I've had three since the iPad came out and they are the best.  I tried the MS Surface and it's very good I have to say that but it's really heavy to lug around.  So it ends up sitting on my desk and not doing what I purchased it to do, move around with me or attending meetings at Starbucks.  Back to the ole scratch pad which just doesn't work for me.  Expensive lesson for sure.

Reviews.Title: Great device. Huge improvement from iPad 4.
Reviews.Author: PSB
Reviews.Content: The iPad Air is much lighter than the iPad 4 before it, in fact it’s lighter than all other tablets in its class at just 469g. That’s a drop of almost 200g, or 29%, on the porky iPad 4. That's a huge generational leap.It’s the first thing you’ll notice when picking it up and it really makes a big difference when using the iPad Air for long periods of time. It’s perfectly balanced. You can hold it to read or watch a movie for hours simply by cupping a corner in your palm. Attempt the same with an iPad 4 and you’ll quickly succumb to shaky arm fatigue.On paper the iPad Air’s Retina screen is the same as the one on the iPad 4. It has a 2,048 x 1,536 IPS panel offering 264 PPI (pixels per inch) with scratch-proof and oleophobic protective glass that's resistant, though not impervious, to greasy fingerprints.ProsVery lightRobust and premium designExcellent screenSolid battery lifeConsummate all-rounderConsStorage comes at a premiumNo Touch ID

Reviews.Title: Great step up
Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the iPad Air from the iPad 1 and am very happy.  Very fast, great resolution, and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: would be five
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Apple doesn't have a Swype app that works with all applications. If you have any android apps with Swype, then hen pecking will drive you nuts. Unless of course you want to add more money and buy a key board. too bad apple doesn't get with the program  here. people need to be efficient.

Reviews.Title: The Ipad Air is Good My packaging was BAD
Reviews.Author: Christopher Ralph
Reviews.Content: I give this 3 stars because of my packaging. I did not get the Lightning to USB Cable, instead i received the 30-pin. My Ipadair

Reviews.Title: Lighter, smaller, faster and Retina, what's not to like
Reviews.Author: Ed "edshull"
Reviews.Content: Purchased to replace a 3rd gen, so obviously a massive improvement. Beautiful screen, nice and compact and very fast. Overall awesome.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: manik sikka
Reviews.Content: I liked my new iPad Air,,,It's Fast, Thin, Longer Battery and it's Awesome. Would recommend to all Who wants to buy an iPad...

Reviews.Title: My review
Reviews.Author: George J. Sliney
Reviews.Content: My wife likes it.  Seems like a good tablet.  Not sure I would buy an iPad again though.  That's all.

Reviews.Title: it was a hit
Reviews.Author: william murray
Reviews.Content: The family loves the christmas gift .It works great.Its attractive ,light weight.Have not had cause to use my protection plan.But i bought it on amazon so i am sure its ok

Reviews.Title: Very good!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Great overall, super light w/ awesome display! Although the battery could be just a bit better. Still a great buy!

Reviews.Title: This thing is amazing
Reviews.Author: Claytonss
Reviews.Content: I got the iPad air today and its amazing I had a kindle fire and the iPad air is 50 times better apple has done it again.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Teresa
Reviews.Content: I am not a very tech savvy person, but this ipad air came highly recommended by a person that is. I asked this person what they thought about other tablets, such as Surface, or Android, which were a little less expensive, but he said this would be the easiest for me to "figure out"---and it has been. I mostly use it to google things, any where from educational to gossip tv shows and can find everything easily. Not only does it have "Siri", you dont even have to type to enter a post on facebook. You just use the microphone thats easily seen, and speak what ever you would normally type. I no im only at the tip of the iceberg with what it can do, but i learn new things everytime i pick it up. Not being able to sit at a computer for very long, Im able to take the ipad to bed with me & look up things easily while resting in bed. I no several people that have them and they all LOVE them---i now see why.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: killercolors
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I am an android user that only recently decided to give apple a try. The only iPad I owned was the 1st generation iPad. Now, that alone wasn't enough to make me change from my android devices, but recently I decided (after seeing how thin this new one was) that I'd give apple another go. -- HOLY COW!!! Where has this tablet been all my life?The Apple iPad air is amazingly light weight, thin, beautiful and crazy fast! This just left my samsung galaxy in the dust with little to no effort involved. Now while I did not get the iPad air from amazon I bought it on eBay, still sealed in the box, brand new, for only $475. That alone was a steal in comparison to buying it on here or anywhere else. I also purchased an iPad air case from walmart so I didn't end up spending over $14 for the case.With that said, if you have a 1st or 2nd gen or are even just now thinking of getting on the apple bandwagon as I have, this is the one to do it with!

Reviews.Title: Quick & painless
Reviews.Author: kathleen miley
Reviews.Content: Arrived quickly and is a great product! A gift for Christmas for my son,  It's definetly being enjoyed - may. Have to get another.

Reviews.Title: super
Reviews.Author: Frank Hendrikx
Reviews.Content: quick, smooth, simple really a fantastic machine. only the battery is quite quicke emtpy, thats a pitty. for the rest fantastic

Reviews.Title: Just what it's supposed to be
Reviews.Author: mikeyyyownz
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas. We have Verizon and I wanted an Ipad for her that was 4g, as well as to upgrade her from the  Ipad 2 she already had. The price was more than going through Verizon, but I needed it quick for Christmas, and I had Amazon gift cards so it came out cheaper for me in my situation.Anyways, I'm not going to go into detail about the Ipad Air. There are countless reviews online. I'm just writing this in case anyone is hesitant to purchase from this specific seller. I got the item quickly and didn't have any problems. The wife was able to connect it to our Verizon account and she uses it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Good product.
Reviews.Author: Foothill Ranch 14
Reviews.Content: Good product but not as mobile as I thought. I prefer my kindle to read but this to watch prime or Netflix on. Sometimes I feel like I have to use it to get my money's worth. But it's good for my family and I.

Reviews.Title: A great product
Reviews.Author: John R. Sitzman
Reviews.Content: Actually light as air and very functional. The first Apple product I have owned but I will definitely buy more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Crazy thin and light plus beautiful screen
Reviews.Author: sgun73 "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I've had every generation of ipad and both minis and several androids and this tablet right here and now is the best ever made and my clear favorite. The thinness and lightness almost doesn't make sense. I did find myself confused at first as to how such an amazing device could be made by humans. Maybe it wasn't. Could have come from space. Or maybe the Enterprise from the future brought it back to Apple and said here. Enjoy.But seriously, the build quality is wonderful. As light and thin as this tablet is it still feels solid and sturdy. The screen is beautiful and the colors are deep and rich. The colors are actually noticeably better than the first and second generation minis. I've held them side by side and there is a pretty wide gap between the two in terms of richness of color. The ipad air looks vibrant and robust with deep blacks and warm bold colors.Plus it's very fast. I loaded up GT Racing 2 last night and it ran flawlessly fast and looked absolutely gorgeous. I couldn't believe how sharp the cars looked and the backgrounds had such depth. I should stop writing and go play right now.Despite the other great tablets like the Nexus 7 and 10 or the Samsung Galaxies 8 and 10 the ipad air is in another realm. A realm all to itself. You'll never pick up another tablet and be shocked at the miracle of design you hold in your hands.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Ben A. Holliday "Ben"
Reviews.Content: It was a gift to my wife and she loves it, so that makes it worth it. As much as she uses the iphone now she at it with the ipad. Shewatches TV and a movie on the iPad at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Loved It!
Reviews.Author: Ramon S. Reyes
Reviews.Content: This iPad Air was a gift for my wife and she continues to enjoy it immensely.  The unit is much lighter than her first generation iPad and the graphics are definitely better.  She can now use Facetime since this new unit has a camera, one that did not come with her original iPad.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Ana Sofia De Agrela
Reviews.Content: The iPad air is the best iPad yet! If you buy it you won't regret it! Really love my new iPad :)

Reviews.Title: Ipad Air
Reviews.Author: Karen A. Stoner
Reviews.Content: So far can find NOTHING wrong (CON) about my new ipad Air!!! (PROS- It is smaller & definitely lighter and has some new features!I had previously purchased the Ipad 2nd Generation and was VERY "happy" with it! BUT in my very rushed world, I dropped and cracked the front screen...:-( Not knowing what to do, BUT knew I didn't want to be WITHOUT my ipad. (I take it almost everywhere I go.) So when someone asked what I wanted for Christmas, I told them! So now I have my travel ipad and my stay-at-home (Ipad Air).So now, I won't be without my Ipad...:-) I will update my review if the need arises.

Reviews.Title: Hubby Loves IPAD!
Reviews.Author: Pinkbubblegum4me
Reviews.Content: Hubby, who is somewhat tech challenged, loves this! So easy to use and READ! Now I can use the desktop computer again!

Reviews.Title: Smaller in a good way
Reviews.Author: Aaron Smith
Reviews.Content: I have really big hands and I can palm this thing.  I truly like the smaller bezel around the edge.  That has always been wasted space in my mind.  I came off an iPad 2 and this one is significantly faster.  Text is significantly clearer on the retina type display.  A great design and works like a charm.

Reviews.Title: Buy one
Reviews.Author: bonniejean815

Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a gift and seems to be well received.  My only problem with this purchase, I seem to have paid about $150. more than everyone else I know that also received the same unit,  Obviously I'm not happy about that.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect besides the lack of RAM and some iOS 7 bugs
Reviews.Author: AK529
Reviews.Content: The ipad air is what the ipad 4 should have been. It is lighter, thinner, narrower, faster and has stereo speakers. Its almost half a pound lighter which really makes a difference when holding the ipad in your hands for long periods of time. I no longer need to use my ipad stand. Typing and holding it in portrait mode are much easier. People with larger hands will be able to hold the ipad with one hand very easily. Performance is also much improved with new A7 processor. Apps open, close and switch faster than on the ipad 4. Wifi is now double the speed with the double mimo antenna. For those who have supporting routers loading web pages, downloading apps, books, videos, music is much faster. The new stereo speakers are much loader and have more bass than on the previous ipad. The stereo affect will only be noticed when holding the iPad in portrait mode. This is a shame since you wont enjoy the stereo affect when watching a video or playing a game in landscape mode. Also the speakers are very easy to muffle if you cover one or both of them on the right side in landscape mode. The main flaw of the ipad air is its lack of 2GB of ram. When browsing and having more than a few tabs open this is very noticeable. The tabs have to reload when switching back and forth. This also becomes an issue when switching between apps that are open. Both the ipad 3 and 4 had 2GB of RAM. The only reason I can think of why apple decided not the upgrade the RAM is to make customers upgrade to the next ipad. The other downside to the ipad air is the fact that its running ios 7. ios 7 for the most part is in improvement over ios 6. It is faster and has more features, but, it also has many bugs that still need to be fixed. Even with 7.04 installed I still experience rotation issues. The ipad doesnt auto rotate when switching between portarit and landscape mode. This issue occurs atleast once a day. Mainly when the multitasking gestures is enabled and auto rotation. There are many threads on apple discussions forums about this issue. I thought at first my ipad was deffective even made an appointment to see a genius. I was told there was no way to test the hardware but was offered a warranty replacment. I decided instead to exchange the ipad and the replacement also had the same issue. I have to add also my ipad 4 had the same issue also when I updated it to ios 7. I hope apple fixes this issue in 7.1. This is very annoying and not something I expected from apple. The ipad air also doesnot have the ability to run 2 or more apps at one time which both the new samsung note 10.1 2014 and Microsoft surface tablet can do. I did try the samsung tablet briefly and found the screen and speakers much better than the ipad air's. The ipad still is the best larger tablet on the market because it has a huge selection of tablet apps and it gets the apps first before any other platform. I also love the battery life on my ipad air. I was getting about 15 hours of usage on my ipad 4 with the brightness at 35% and about 5 notifications with browsing and email. Now with the ipad air I am gettting more than 15 hours. Anywhere from 16-18 hours of battery life depending on my usage. The new ipad air is must have for gamers, power users and people who take the ipad on the go. If you can wait the next ipad will defeintly have 2GB of RAM and wont have as many bugs. There is also a good chance a new ipad will be released in the next 1-2 years which will be larger in screen size and more powerful named the ipad pro.Update after owning for more than 4 months: Apple just released the 7.1 update. My iPad Air is finally stable, this is what ios 7 should have been from the start. There are no more crashes, reboots and the auto rotation issue is fixed. I am still giving this ipad 4 stars since it took apple more than 4 months to fix these issues. Also the ipad lacks 2gb of ram, there are no widgets, thrid party keyboards, expandable storage or way to run 2 apps at once side by side. The iPad Air is till the best 10 inch tablet on the market. It beats any android or microsoft tabelt currently on the market in the 10 inch category. Also it has the most tablet apps.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Diane Allen
Reviews.Content: What an amazing ipad! The ipad air is wonderful! Light, fast, all the computer you need! Apple products are hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: IPad is GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet

Reviews.Content: Amazing, it's my first i-x and I really like it. Strongly recomended for people that need just a tablet at home...

Reviews.Title: I’m glad I did otherwise I wouldn’t have bought this tablet
Reviews.Author: Bastijn McFerrell
Reviews.Content: I owned a second generation iPad before needing to sell it for personal reasons. In hindsight, I’m glad I did otherwise I wouldn’t have bought this tablet.Before deciding on the iPad Air I considered the Kindle Fire and Nexus 7. The Microsoft Surface wasn’t an option since I really don’t like the operating system or customer service and I wanted my tablet to last longer than a year. Samsung wasn’t an option after the torture my Galaxy S3 put me through, which also ruled out Android, which then ruled out the Nexus 7. Some people are a fan of Android but I find it to be slow, unreliable and choppy. The aesthetic design isn’t my favorite either. But these are all a matter of personal opinion and experience. :)The Kindle Fire HDX looked great at first, but in the end I decided it wasn’t for me. I’m a writer and a student so being able to edit documents on the go is my main concern. I have an iMac so this unfortunately made using the Kindle for these purposes a little more difficult for me. While I can edit and share most documents on my iMac, including Microsoft Office, I primarily use Pages which isn’t available on the Kindle. I just don’t care for either Microsoft Word or Google Docs enough to use them all the time. Also, I never use the Amazon store to watch movies or shows or download music so that feature wasn’t appealing to me. I took a trip to Best Buy to try it out just in case that made me change my mind. This actually solidified my decision against it. While the Kindle Fire did feel surprisingly solid, I didn’t like the position of the buttons, smaller screen size (although the screen quality was pretty awesome) or the thick boarders around the screen. Again, all of these are a matter of preference.When I went to try out the iPad Air I was surprised by how much lighter it felt than the previous model iPad. I also liked the flat back and thinner edges on the side. It made using it easier for small handed people like me. The larger screen size made typing on the tablet much easier in those rare instances I might not have my keyboard. Keeping my documents in one place is amazingly simple and I like the applications I use for writing and classes. Also, iTunes U is just awesome!The only drawback for me is the price: I paid $300 more than I would have with the Kindle Fire HDX. I don’t think this is outrageously expensive, considering the larger screen, better hardware, operating system and customer service-- not to mention iTunes U-- but I do think the price could be lower.While there are other great tablets out there, I really enjoy my iPad Air. Electronics are all a matter of personal preference anymore anyway. If you don’t like a device, don’t buy it. It’s that simple. :)

Reviews.Title: Heavy Apple user, this not up to snuff
Reviews.Author: JustAGuy
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the ipad 1 to the ipad air mainly because of constant crashes with the ipad 1.The Air still crashes. From what I've read most people think it's a software issue, if that's the case then this is a 4 star product.What keeps it from a 5th star the the feel of the screen. The ipad 1 felt solid, like glass. This has a hollow plastic feel to it. Feels like if you type too hard it'll snap.I own almost every product Apple makes, this feels like I'm holding the decline of Apple in my hand.

Reviews.Title: Apple did a wonderful job on this.
Reviews.Author: S. Carter "carter the artist"
Reviews.Content: Granted I wanted the Space Gray and got stuck with a White, due to human error from the shipper. However, I think they did great on this iPad. I had an iPad 1 and it lasted for years (except for the fact that I couldn't update the iOS for the past year or so) and the difference in weight and speed is very noticeable.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Vertigo
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet with a fatally flawed web browser problem.  My iPad Air started with Safari crashing right out of the box.  I put up with it for a month and then had it replaced by Apple under warranty, however, the problem continued.  The experts at the Genius Bar said the problem would be fixed in iOS 7.1.  After upgrading to 7.1 today the issue persists.  Puffin browser seems more stable but still crashes on occasion.  Apple's failure to fix this is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Wish It Just Worked (Without Crashing So Much) And A Comparison With Other Devices
Reviews.Author: S. Jo
Reviews.Content: I'm not happy with this tablet but I got a good deal on it from one of the retail stores, $100 off, and it fits my needs best compared to what's currently being offered.The iPad Mini 2 is lighter but the screen is smaller and can't display as many colors, less gamut display. I've noticed this with my "old" Samsung Galaxy Tab 7 Plus, but this may not matter to some people.The Kindle HDX and Nexus 7 (2013) are, in that order, reported to have better screens- ppi and gamut display. However I'm not interested in buying too much into the Amazon App Store because I'm already in the plain Android ecosystem. The Samsung tablet line is not in consideration because I got burned by how the copy and paste function just stops working- a reset would fix it and soon after it would stop working. This issue first showed itself months after I got the device. I also wasn't interested in taking the time to jailbreak the Samsung tablet for that reason alone.I recently got a deal on the Nexus 7 (2013) and I'm getting it this week. I may keep it as a backup tablet and it's a plus that I'm already in the Android ecosystem. It has 2GB of RAM instead of Apple's current 1GB of RAM standard. It also comes with stock Android and the operating system can be easily upgraded without relying on mods. I'm hoping it will last 5 years but I've learned from the Amazon customer reviews that hardware quality control is an issue.Now back to the iPad Air. Aside from the screen I wanted the "Apple Experience" of "It just works." I like using a tablet for browsing and reading books. I also liked the idea of having access to apps that are exclusive to Apple. I've had the iPad Air for a little over a week and I'm really enjoying the bigger screen. I'm not sure I can really switch back to a smaller screen. I've downloaded a few apps, cooking related, that are exclusive to iOS and they're nice to have. Multitouch gesture is ok but the Android way of switching between apps and viewing running apps are more elegant.Why I took off three stars is because the iPad Air crashes a lot. It got to the point that I'd add a tab on Safari and it would crash even though I only had two other tabs open. I installed Chrome and the crashes happened less but they did not disappear. Search for iOS 7 crashes and low memory and you'll see this is a problem with a lot of iOS devices since the iOS 7 was introduced. I noticed other apps doing the same thing but maybe because I use them less I don't see them crashing as often.I had set up a phone appointment with Apple Support on Sunday and was told that upgrading to iOS 7.0.4 via WiFi might have caused the iOS to not fully update. I couldn't stay on the phone for too long so yesterday I did reset my tablet and set the iPad as New. I didn't buy their reasoning but I did like the Customer Support experience- setting up an appointment online etc.I really like the bigger screen and it's probably better for my eyes so I'm keeping the device. I'm also counting on Apple to fix the issue sooner rather than later- in various forums you'll read about people resetting their iOS device and doing multiple exchanges with no relief from the crashing. I will sign up for Apple Care+ which includes 2 Years of Tech Support and Accidental Damage so I can exchange the device if needed.

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Penny

Reviews.Title: Hands down one of the greatest devices I have ever owned/used

Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my iPad. For years I was annoyed by the hype of it all, but finally decided to get one. WOW, is it everything and more!  I'm even not a mac person, but Apple certainly knows what they're doing. I use this for work and fun. It has movies, music, games, as well as Microsoft Office, DropBox, and my multiple email accounts. I think it is IMPORTANT to note that I am returning the one I just purchased, but only because 32 GB was NOT BIG ENOUGH. If you are a casual user, 32 GB is fine. I use it for work and family, though, and within 5 days (after downloading all my necessary work-related apps and then a few games) that I was 10GB down out of 32 (which is actually only 27 because the operating system uses the first 5GB). If you want this for entertainment or actual work, get the 64!

Reviews.Content: The exceptional engineering continues by Apple. The new iPad is so light and fast with brilliant picture quality that I watched most of the March Madness on it when I wasn't near a good sports bar. Very fast, love the apple apps

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Love the iPad Air
Reviews.Author: Ann de Vries
Reviews.Content: I bought my 128GB iPad Air with 3G  and had trouble using it because my husband couldn't keep his hands off it. He loved it so much that we got one for him. We bought the Apple cases for both of them and my husband bought the stylus, as well.We  are both very pleased with these tablets. My husband has a neurological condition and the accessibility features and stylus have been wonderful for him. He stopped using his laptop for portability, because the iPad Air does everything he wants. We were afraid it would be too heavy for him to hold, but he has found it to be lightweight and comfortable, and it does weigh less than earlier iPads. Anyone with vision and fine motor skills problems is almost certain to love the iPad Air, especially when combined with the stylus.I dropped my iPad twice when in parking lots, both times from low heights, but on hard surfaces. The case protected it and I have had no problems resulting from the drops.We use our iPad Airs primarily for reading Kindle books. Our joint account has a huge archive and our other devices were not handling it. The K4iPad app and this unit work beautifully together and we have had no problems accessing our books. This iPad is powerful.We were worried about how comfortable it would be to read for long periods because we kept hearing that tablet screens bothered one's eyes. We found it easy to use the settings to adjust the screen lighting, and found an adjustment that has caused no eye problems, even when reading for several hours. It has been very comfortable. We have also read in fairly bright sun with no problems. However, when the sun was actually hitting the screen, it was impossible to read on it.We do use the iPad Air for many other functions. Games, surfing the web, eMail, videos, music, photos, YouTube, social networking sites, and so on, work as well as on a computer. The battery lasts a long time and the 3G is a real bonus when wi-fi is not available.I have seen some negative reviews of the iPad Air, and I don't doubt that some people have had bad experiences. All I can say is that we have had good experiences with Apple. Our iMac was out of warranty and still working when Apple notified us they were replacing the hard drive on all iMacs like ours, because the hard drives had an unacceptable failure rate. When we took it in to the Apple store, I asked them to also check my iPod Touch, which was two years out of warranty and had become very temperamental and glitchy. They found a corrupted file on the iPod Touch and got it set up and working for me, and didn't charge anything.  We have had good experiences with the iPad Air and are extremely happy with both of ours.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful

Reviews.Content: This is a ergonomic, user friendly, electronic media formate for the casual user.  Apple will be my choice for my next computer!

Reviews.Title: Love my Apple IPad Air

Reviews.Content: Love it! Fits my needs perfectly! Highly recommended. Fast, graphics are really crisp. Light weight, fits in my hand nicely.

Reviews.Title: Great iPad Air
Reviews.Author: R. Kattman
Reviews.Content: I love my iPad Air.  It replaces my iPod 4.  It meets all of expectations.  Only sorry that I did not purchase it sooner.

Reviews.Title: Shipping was fast and product is great.
Reviews.Author: andrew
Reviews.Content: Shipping was fast and product is great. My only complaint is that I wish I had access to a terminal so that I could hack together some python code in my spare time.

Reviews.Title: Apple is slipping in the software department
Reviews.Author: John S. Ruzicka "John R"
Reviews.Content: I was excited to replace my old iPad with the newest version. The Air has some big improvements. It's smaller (with the same screen size) and faster and can run multiple apps at the same time.The bummer for me is that ios7 feels like it is unfinished and that it wasn't sufficiently tested. First off, Safari crashes ALL THE TIME. I've only had one or two crashes on my old iPad so this took some getting used to. Secondly, there is the "white screen of death" where the iPad will just reboot itself for no apparent reason. Again, Apple products just don't behave this way so this was a huge disappointment. Finally, it is long past time that iOS add a real file system for saving files and sharing them between apps. Yes, the cloud works OK and Dropbox has become the de-facto standard for those who don't want to use Apple Cloud but come on, it's way past time for a file system.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad
Reviews.Author: Chari
Reviews.Content: Received this item on time, boxed securely and works wonderful.  Set it up to match my iPhone accounts and is working great!  Just need a cover for it now.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: Curt
Reviews.Content: This is my first Apple device and I have to say I'm loving it. I use it for a small business and it has all the apps I need. I love the size of the device - large screen yet the tablet is nice and thin and light. The case that I got for it adds a very minor amount of bulk. As a new Apple user I was impressed by how easy the interface is to use. Since I have to store a lot of photos for my business, I purchased the 32gb model and I'm glad I did. Even though I store most of my stuff on a cloud app, I'm glad I don't have to worry about filling up my tablet.PROS:GREAT battery life. I literally had this on for 3 days straight during a convention and it was used constantly - just barely made it down to 20% battery by the end of the 3 days. Charges back up fairly fast tooScreen size is big but not too big, tablet is lightweight and thinEverything runs fast and smoothCONS:Cord of the charger it came with is very short (just a minor gripe, but still!)Screen gets dirty easily and I haven't found a decent screen protector yet (another minor gripe)Safari, the default browser, sucks. Install something else! I recommend chrome or firefoxI know the ipad air is pricey, but I found this to be much better and easier to use than my laptop, which I have now given to my fiance for his use. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: diane sharp
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my sweetheart who is a computer engineer and not much for gadgets. However, he uses the pad downstairs in his home and for vacations. He has more mobility, gets to check mail and learned to write mail. The color resolution is great. His only complaint is that the apps are nothing like having a full on software program. Of course, any sensitive accounts are not on the pad. He thanks me all the time and thinks I should have one also.

Reviews.Title: Upgrading from the original ipad
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: I am glad I didn't upgrade until this version of the iPad.  It's a fantastic device.  It's fast and far more capable from the clunky original ipad.  It's battery life is baffling.  I literally plug it in at most once every two weeks.  It's around for quick web searches, some games and email.  I am sure I could drain the battery in a day, if I tried hard enough, but I'd probably lose my mind in the process.I own a lot of Android devices, as well.  They  don't deserved to be considered in the same breath.  Their engineering is all over the spectrum, but never reach the heights of Apple's flawless execution.  I attribute android's failure to it's architecture around Java and old school mentality of making a product that works, sells, but never excels.  There's literally no better alternative  than an apple device, and I am not a Steve Jobs fan.

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth the upgrade from any prior iPad model
Reviews.Author: The Badboy "Badboy Studios Inc."
Reviews.Content: The iPad 3 was my first iPad and I've used it up to the point I bought this iPad Air. I had cracked my screen and it seemed as if it was slowing down over time, probably due to the updated operating systems putting more stress on the aging processor and memory.So, I saw a good deal on a used model appear on Amazon, and decided to go for it. For little over $500, after I traded in my older model, I had a brand-new, or close to it, iPad Air. The first thing you'll notice is the weight. It is at least half that of the previous models. The bezel thinner on the sides and the new thunderbolt port on the bottom. I also love the addition of stereo speakers, as I own one of the biggest recording studios on the East Coast and love to try out the music I produce on a multitude of sound systems. This allows me to hear what I've done in stereo, on a lower common denominator, so as to know what my music sounds like coming from the speakers of a system millions of people own.The next thing I noticed, is the screen seemed quite a bit brighter then my iPad 3. This could just be because of the aging screen tech under the glass, or some other factor. But it definitely helps for reading, even at half power, in darker and lighter situations that I have no control over. Next up, the speed at which everything operates. Not only loading software and apps, but in switching apps and multitasking. There is just a zip to everything now.The biggest thing I noticed, the Internet is 10 times as fast as it was in my prior model. I'm going to guess the MIMO has something to do with that, along with the two antennas. Giving a stronger signal, which in turn allows for the fastest Internet possible. I have 50 Mb Internet, and I now feel like I'm using every bit of it in doing something as simple as loading webpages or downloading videos, games and music. When I load a webpage, everything appears instantly, no more loading in of different aspects of that page, everything is just there. I think it is the first time, and Ive owned  hundreds of computers over the years, that I've noticed any webpage load so instantly.Games look every bit as good as they can, due to the increased processing power of the CPU and GPU. If Apple would only make a proprietary gamepad for the iPad, they would have a true contender for a great video game system on the market. Some of the games, especially those from Gameloft and EA, have every bit the quality that you see from any game on modern systems, bar a few effects here and there.Even music production can be done at high-quality, for the home or studio producer, with decent results. I've heard some songs recorded completely via the iPad, that you would've sworn were done in multi-million-dollar studios. They are that good. Which goes to show, great music is made by a great producer and not the equipment behind him.So, to sum things up:Positives:Great, bright, high resolution screenSmaller and lighterIncredible portable powerGreatly improved internet speedStereo speakers built inAwesome games and production softwareCheap accessories from third party vendorsNegative:Price, though I imagine we would sacrifice some quality at a lower price pointOverall, you will not find a better portable computer for the price. Anything Windows is going to have issues. Whether that be with drivers, malware, viruses or some or the other issue that goes along with owning a Windows machine. Sure, they are more powerful and will allow you a greater depth of software, but you make trade-offs with that power in size, weight and ease-of-use. So, if you have the means, definitely get the iPad Air. The upgrades are truly worth the extra cost over previous models. It's like having a super computer under your fingertips everywhere you go.

Reviews.Title: Converted Fangirl
Reviews.Author: HardatTwerk
Reviews.Content: So..for a long time..I hated apple. But I get it now..it just works. It simply works. Its beautiful..feels great in my hand. Turns heads and its very easy to type on. Its zippy, and has made my life so much easier. I am a graphic artist/ web designer. I draw on this and take notes and photos every now and then. Reviews.Title: Incredibly light, fast and beautiful. Is it the best tablet for you?
Reviews.Author: John Ryan
Reviews.Content: The new iPad Air is Apple's latest, slimmest, lightest release of their hand-held computer. Oddly enough, it's so beautifully easy to use (my one year old daughter loves playing with it), it's almost doesn't feel like a computer at all.A word of warning - this review is written for people who've never owned an iPad before - and are wondering what all the fuss is about. If you're thinking of upgrading skip down to the "What's great about the Air" section below, or just buy it - it's amazing.Just what's all the fuss about?--------------------------------------I used to own a laptop for work, and (very occasionally), it'd sit on my lap on the sofa, and I'd use it for pleasure (eMail, watching films or playing the odd game). Then I bought my first iPad, and the laptop became redundant, a boring "work device". Hard to explain, but the fact the iPad is so small and light, and you navigate around with your finger by pointing and gently swiping the screen makes the whole experience a lot easier - a lot more fun.Even my most "luddite" of friends have been won over.It's incredibly simple and easy to use (it only has one main button), and everyone from my one year old daughter to my 85 year old dad have taken to without problems. It's size and shape also support using it like a book (literally to read a book or web page), but you can also watch TV and films.Personally I'm also paranoid about my password getting "hacked", and someone running up a huge Amazon bill or buying stuff with my credit card on eBay. Well one of the benefits of the iPad (and iPhone) is it's "almost impossible" to get a virus - one of the most common ways to get hacked. This doesn't mean you shouldn't use strong passwords, (both Sony and Adobe got hacked), but it's reassuring to leave the Windows world behind.Finally, I love the way these devices (iPad, iPhone, Apple TV, Apple Mac), increasingly work together. The fact you can start a Pages document on your Mac and edit it on your iPad, or take photos on the iPhone, and in seconds see them on the iPad or Mac and display them on the Apple TV.The thing is, "it just works".What would you use if for?----------------------------------* Shopping online. Obviously - you could be reading a review on Amazon about the iPad Air!* Reading web pages. As you can hold it like a book it's great to read the news online (my wife loves the Daily Mail Online).* Reading Books. It's great for reading books from Amazon Kindle or Apple Books with the benefit of 1,000s of online book reviews* Navigating web pages. Instead of clicking with a mouse, you gently swipe your fingers on screen to scroll around* Watching Films. I use it to watch Netflix online videos (with an Apple TV you can send stuff to the telly)* Watching TV. With the free BBC iPlayer app you can catch up or download BBC programs* Reading and replying to mail. I use "mailbox" a great free app to read and reply to mails, but there's a free one included* Showing and organising photos. Any photos on an iPhone are automatically available within minutes in "the cloud"* Playing games. From fun puzzle games like "Cut the Rope" to fully fledged first person shooters.* Listening to the Radio. With "Tune in Radio" you can listen to thousands of radio stations world-wide.* Listening to music. I stream mine to an Apple TV, but you can also buy portable speakers or just plug into the AUX socket* Editing Word, Excel and Powerpoint documents using FREE App "QuickOffice" (owned and supported by Google).* Editing Pages, Numbers and Keynote documents (Office for the Apple) on the FREE Apple apps.* The list goes on and on.Update: You can edit Word, Excel and Powerpoint documents (plus Pages, Numbers and Keynote) on the iPad (although I'd recommend an external keyboard - see below). It's definately powerful enough, although I'd not expect these apps to cope with REALLY complex document layouts. Great for general letter and document writing though.Which model should I buy?----------------------------------I can't comment about Android tablets (apart from the Google Nexus 7 which is well regarded), but in terms of the Apple tablet line-up in order of cost:-1. Avoid the Apple iPad 2, it's a relatively old model, under-powered and with a lower resolution screen. If you really want an Apple but don't want to spend the cash, buy a 16g WIFI 3rd or 4th generation iPad from eBay. Avoid this one.2. iPad mini is a lovely tablet. A 7.9 inch screen and astonishingly light and remarkably thin - it feels like a light-weight book.3. iPad mini with retina screen. Again 7.9 inch screen, but with the blazingly fast A7 chip and a "retina" (high definition) screen. Worth the upgrade if you can afford it.4. iPad Air. Much larger screen size (9.7 inches - doesn't sound much but it makes a huge difference). Same fast (A7) chip as the Mini with Retina - the latest and fastest iPad available.Clearly (from my viewpoint) there's only really three options. The iPad Mini, the Mini with retina screen and Air.What are the Optional add-ons?-----------------------------------------Well, assuming you've dropped by the Apple Store or John Lewis (which I would highly recommend), and handled the iPad Mini (with/without retina screen), and iPad Air then your options are around memory size and cellular option.Memory: Once bought, you can't add memory (space for apps, films, books etc). However, the basic price goes up a huge amount (+£80 for the 16g to 32g iPad Air). But, having owned a 16g and then a 32g iPad - I can safely recommend the 16g unless you really want to store a huge amount of videos and downloads. Only you can decide, and if you're lucky enough that money is no object then splash out. Otherwise, 16g should be fine for most people.Celular: Allows you to connect to the internet while you're out and about. This will add an additional +£100 to the price and means you can slip in a mobile phone SIM card. This means (for an additional £7-15 a month extra), you can access the internet on the move. Alternatively, you can opt for the WIFI option, and use it at home or at at "hot spot" (eg. Starbucks, most rail stations and hotels etc).Personally I'd buy (and indeed did), the 16Gb iPad Air WIFI.Do I need anything else?-------------------------------Most people (me included) buy a cover. Apple (and now several copy-cats) make a "smart-cover" which automatically shuts down the iPad when you close it, and switches it on when you open it. There's versions which cover the back, or just the screen. Apple charge from £35 to £65 for their (admittedly) high quality fabric or leather covers, but there's many available from £10. Be aware, you do get what you pay for.Personally,I think it's a pity to cover the beautiful aluminium industrial design of the iPad with a cover - but if you've spent hundreds of pounds you'll want to protect it from scrapes and bangs.I also invested in a keyboard (£25-80), as I tend to write a lot of mails and documents (remember it comes with a word processor). I'd recommend the Logitech Ultra Thin iPad Air Case with Keyboard - Space Greyand the ZAGG Keys iPad Air Case Folio with Backlit Keyboard - Black although these are strictly optional unless you want to use your iPad as a proper laptop.Finally, if you have another Apple device (eg. an iPhone, Apple TV or Mac) you'll find these work together beautifully. For example, you can create a reminder on your iPad and it appears on your iPhone. Equally, photos taken on your iPhone appear on your iPad, and you can stream music or videos from iPad, iPhone or Mac to an Apple TV.Some people think this "locks you in" - but it's your choice.What's great about the Air?-----------------------------------* Lighter (30%) and thinner than the previous version (469g from 650g)* Even faster A7 chip. Blazingly fast!* Improved sound (compared to the iPad 4)* Software including+ iMovie - edit and publish home made movies+ Numbers - Fully functional Excel for the iPad+ Pages - Word processor+ GarageBand - Play a piano or a drum kit+ iPhoto - Edit and organise your photosWhat's not so great?--------------------------* The change in physical size means you'll need a new keyboard or replacement cover if you're upgrading* Pity Apple didn't include the "touch ID" to secure your passwordsOverall Opinion---------------------It's hard to believe the iPad version 1 was released just four years ago, and there's a huge raft of "me too" tablet computers to choose from, but the Apple iPad Air is still the one to beat. As "Which?" magazine (in the UK) put it - "...the best tablet we've ever tested. Apple packs a beautiful screen and lightning fast processor into a slimmer-than-ever shell, and battery life is very impressive".Yes, there are cheaper Android based alternatives, but the quality, design and beauty of this tablet just sets it apart. If it were a car it'd be a top of the range Mercedes or a BMW.Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: The future is a breeze
Reviews.Author: The Guardian
Reviews.Content: The iPad has established itself in four short years as the 'tablet of choice' to which all others are compared, and the Air is the newest and coolest in the family.First of all, the good news. At 467g the Air redefines computer portability and is so lightweight it's hard to tell whether you're carrying it in your bag or have in fact forgotten it, without looking to check. The Air has a fast A7 chip and the screen is a useful 9.7 inches; it's a breeze to use. The design of the graphics is so intuitive that any child or technophobe can master it and feel at home in a few minutes, which makes it the perfect entry-point into IT for someone who has so far avoided computers.One of the clever things Apple have done is the creation of the individual `Apple ID' which means once you enter your ID & password your iPad, iPhone, iPod and Mac immediately share all their files, and everything you created or stored on one device becomes available on them all: photos, music, reminders, address book, documents are all shared. This is probably the most brilliant idea ever in the IT mass market to create brand loyalty among consumers and `locks you in to the corporation for the duration'.Now, the bad news: the software crashes from time to time necessitating a reboot, which is annoying and inconvenient. This fault is acknowledged by Apple, as the software has a few bugs. Also the wireless reception is not all it might be, as it sometimes (mysteriously) fails to connect to even a moderately strong signal.Apple's pricing structure does not reflect the cost of manufacture but is driven by a market segmentation strategy, so the price really cranks up if you want an iPad with more memory or which can use the GSM phone network. The best value is the 16G Air without Cellular, which only connects to the internet via WiFi. 16G is a lot of memory by the historic standards of portable computers and you'll only find it insufficient if you want to store a lot of big files like films or powerpoint presentations.You'll need a carrying case to protect it (scores of different designs are available) and maybe a keyboard, which if you're doing a lot of writing and document creation rather than just surfing the internet is the one essential accessory, as without a separate keyboard the usable screen area is reduced in size. Around one million downloadable apps for Apple devices means you can personalize your iPad and make it into more or less whatever you want. The Air design is aesthetically a work of beauty in its simplicity, cleanness of lines and proportion, and despite some irritating niggles is a pleasure to own and use.

Reviews.Title: Love it, but had connection problem during set up
Reviews.Author: Bookenz
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite iPad so far, despite an initial wifi connection problem. I bought the original iPad, iPad 2, and iPad 3 (which I returned because of heating issues and thickness/weight and went back to the iPad 2).I was ready to buy a new iPad because my iPad 2 16gb was filled up.  So I decided on the iPad Air. The first thing I noticed when I took it out of the box was that it really is much lighter than even the iPad 2.  The screen is the same size, but the frame is narrower, so it's smaller overall.  I have the white 128gb wifi version.  Set up was problematic though, which is why I've taken away a star.  When asked to put in my home wifi password, I received a message that it was entered wrong. Repeatedly.  Well, it wasn't wrong because it's the same password as my other wireless devices.  Nothing I did would make it take the password, so I called Apple tech support. After being on the phone with the technician for at least 45 minutes, nothing worked. Turning my modem and router off and on did nothing. Changing some of the iPad's settings, again, nothing. I felt disappointed, frustrated, and let down by Apple. Finally, the tech set an appointment for me to take it into the Apple store and see if they could get it to connect to their wifi. Before we hung up, the tech suggested I connect the iPad to the iTunes on my computer and do a complete software restore and see if that would resolve the connection issue.  I did this, which took about an hour, and FINALLY was able to connect to my wifi. The connection has been stable so far.Other than the above initial connection problem, I am really loving the iPad Air. Sharp retina display, thinner and lighter, and faster connection (I use the Mercury Browser, not clunky Safari). The white frame with silver edges is really nice looking. I read a lot of ebooks, so the lighter weight is very much appreciated since it can be held comfortably with one hand. I also listen to audiobooks and this iPad has two speakers instead of one. They're located on the edge of the device, not the back, so you don't have to have the iPad back side up to get unmuffled sound. The sound quality of the iPad Air is superior to the iPad 2, and the volume can be turned up slightly louder. I've only played one game so far, Plants vs. Zombies 2, but it plays great. I don't use the camera and really wish Apple would make a version sans that option. It feels cool when holding--the iPad 3 I had got too warm on one side, which this one doesn't do. I haven't had any other problems and I think this is the best iPad yet. As far as the initial wifi connection issue I had, I'm going to assume this was a fluke with my device, and not something a lot of people are experiencing (although I have seen a few mentions of this on some of the Apple forums).

Reviews.Title: IPAD AIR unusable, tech support is worthless.
Reviews.Author: Dr. Sarah M. Young
Reviews.Content: I purchased the IPAD air last week. When I tried to activate my accounts it would not allow it because apparently since I changed carriers I could not use my old Apple ID because it is tied to the old carrier. I can't establish a new Apple ID because I have an old one and if they delete the old one I lose all the apps I've paid for. I contacted Apple Technical where I was required to purchase tech support before they would do anything.  After doing this I went through multiple calls with multiple levels of support over three days so far with more to come. Seems that if the tech makes a mistake it stops the process and you have to wait 24 hours for them to be able to continue. They promise to call back and so far they have not so I called them to start the frustrating cycle all over again. I can't get the apps I want until this if fixed. I also can't connect to Facebook. For a machine this expensive plus having to pay for tech support for something that is Apple's fault I now believe Apple products aren't worth the gas to go buy one. I've been using Apples since the Apple Plus and I feel abused as a customer for the IPAD AIR. On top of all this they just had the gall to send me an email thanking me for contacting Apple Support. They have charged me for something a user should be able to do online with a new machine that is supposed to be the latest and greatest and it is just a paper weight right now. Can't return it because there is nothing wrong with it. Seems to me Apple is unethical and does not care about customers after a purchase. Dr. Sarah young

Reviews.Title: Good for its use cases.
Reviews.Author: rpv
Reviews.Content: I have been using Android tablets for past 3 years. I decided to take the plunge for iPAD AIR due to its weight and for sheer desire to see what is in place. I should admit I do love Android, and would like a Android OS on a iPAD like hardware. I miss the BACK  capacitive button the most.Broadly I see different categories of people in vertical basis- by size: phones (4-5"), mini tablets 7-8", tablets 9-10"- by OS: Android, iOS, FireOS and maybe Windows 8- by cost: cost conscious and gadget freaks who have no care for the money and pile it on the plastic card- by disease: who have TACS [ Tablet Acquisition and Craving Syndrome ]SPEC COMPARISON:To begin, let me deep dive into specs of a broad range of top tablets as of now. --Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1",iPAD Air 9.7",Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1",Google Nexus 10" andSamsung Galaxy Tab 3 8"I am throwing in the Tab 8 as I feel there will be a segment of people who are inclined for it in favor or HDX. Reading the specs for WHAT matters to YOU most is critical. I know for some people, the weight matters, for some size. For some the SD card is a deal breaker. So read on..key_specs of leading tablets as of 2013: { model: resolution, ppi, CPU, RAM, Flash memory, SD_card, camera spec, weight, OS_type, size, charging/sync port type, GPS:y/n }Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" model: 2560 x 1600, 339 ppi, Snapdragon 800 2.2 GHz quad-core, 2 GB RAM, 16/32/64 Flash Memory, No microSD card, 8MP rear-facing camera, front-facing 720p HD camera, 374 grams, FireOS 3.0, 9.1 x 6.2 x 0.31 inches, microUSB, GPS:no [cellular versions have GPS]Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1" 2014 Edition: 2560x1600, 299 ppi, 1.9GHz Samsung Exynos 5420 Quad-Core Processor, 3GB RAM, 16/32 GB Flash Memory, microSD slot:yes(upto 64 GB), 8MP rear camera and 2 MP front-facing camera, 560 grams, Android 4.3 Jelly Bean OS, 9.57 x 6.75 x 0.31 inches, microUSB, GPS:yes. S-Pen (flagship),iPAD Air 9.7" (2013): 2048 x 1536 resolution, 264 ppi, A7/M7/64 bit processor, Flash Memory: 16/32/64/128 GB, SD Card:no, 5 MP back, 1.2 MP front, 469 grams, iOS 7, 9.4 x 6.6 x 0.29 in, lightning port, GPS:no [cellular versions have GPS]Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1" model: 1280 x 800, 149 ppi, Intel Atom 1.6GHz Z2560 dual-core processor, 1GB RAM, Flash Memory: 16/32GB, microSD slot: yes upto 64 GB, 3.2MP rear-facing, 1.3MP front-facing, 510 grams, Android 4.2.2, 9.57 x 6.93 x 0.31 in, micoUSB port:yes, GPS:yesGoogle Nexus 10" model: 2560 x 1600, 300 ppi, CPU: Dual-core A15, 2GB RAM, 16/32 GB, SD:no, rear:5 MP, front:1.9 MP, 603g, 10.4" x 7" x 0.35", mcroUSB, GPS:yesSamsung Galaxy Tab 3 8" model: 1280 x 800, 189 ppi, Exynos 1.5GHz dual-core processor, 1.5GB RAM, Flash memory: 16/32GB, microSD slot: yes upto 64 GB, 5MP rear-facing, 1.3MP front-facing, 309 grams, Android 4.2, 8.26 x 4.87 x 0.29 in, microUSB port:yes, GPS: yesYou should come up with three top three specs you want and should be able to nail it down with the above spec. If you have doubts shoot me a comment, I can help!Having used several tablets, I like the hardware weight and screen resolution of iPAD Air. It takes 3-4 years for a tablet maker to reach an acceptable level. All previous full size iPADs were heavy for me. I won't go into details of iOS7 itself. I am also disappointed Apple has GPS only on 4G models. The apps and security of iOS platform is generally good. What I don't like is the iTunes way of syncing up. Not a USB drap and drop. This is the primary reason for me giving a 4 stars. Android trumps in this regard.Overall being a geek, I like all makers. I don't bias and want Apple to succeed. Success of Apple will propel Google and other makers of tablets. My wishlist is to try a a Windows tablet once they get through a iteration cycle in late 2014.Overall iPAD is a delightful tablet as long as you accept its limitations. I use with the light Pink case which is bright and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: Love the new Ipad Air
Reviews.Author: HowardD
Reviews.Content: No issues whatsoever. We bought two for Christmas. Kids love them. They do what they are supposed to do. We recommend it

Reviews.Title: The best full size iPad yet
Reviews.Author: Sioux Hockey Fan
Reviews.Content: I received this gift for Christmas this year after having waited over two years to finally make the jump into the tablet market. I can honestly say that I am happy with my choice.I personally found that the iPad Air has the perfect balance of portability, durability, productivity, app selection, and screen size for my needs. For me, it beats the rest of the tablet market right now.I got the 64GB Wi-Fi version, but found that I would have been more than happy with the 32GB version and a little bit of selective storage.iOS 7 is still not perfect for iPad yet, but honestly most Android skins aren't perfect either. Additionally, the app selection from the App Store specifically designed for tablets is just amazing.

Reviews.Title: I love the Air
Reviews.Author: Joe R. Sayers
Reviews.Content: I have bought an iPad in the past, the 2nd generation.  After having it for a few weeks, it was nice, but to me was just heavy, the dimensions (not including the screen) just seemed so big and it wasn't comfortable to hold.  I sold that one off, but recently decided to give the iPad Air a try, and I must say I am extremely impressed.  I know it takes a while for technology to sometimes get up to speed with what our expectation of it should be, and the iPad Air has definitely done that.The dimensions are great, it is SO light, SO thin, and it is not as wide or tall as the previous models, which make it much more comfortable to hold and use.The processor is so fast, and I can't help but continue to be impressed by all that comes along with that in use of apps, daily routines of email, facebook, games, learning apps, etc..  The hardware is also just absolutely beautiful.  Sure you can get other tablets at a lower price, but I don't think that the build quality, processor speed, or overall user experience can be matched.I love my iPad!

Reviews.Title: My First IPad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My IPad was received with a dent on the side where the box had also been dented. I was able to replace it at my local Apple Store.  I am not sure when this dent occurred but it took awhile before I wanted to go to the Mall and exchange it.With the holidays,  haven't had a lot of time to get to know my new IPad.  This week.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad Air 32GB Wi-Fi

I am impressed with the clarity & sharpness of the display and the thinness & decreased weight over the original iPad I have been using for several years. I would recommend the iPad Air to everyone who wants the very best in there tablet. You will NOT go wrong picking the iPad Air.

Reviews.Content: You really do have to experience this iPad to believe the amazement about it. Not only is it lighter, it is faster. much faster. Let's compare it with the iPhone 4 for instance. The iPad air is 3x as fast as that, making web-browsing and app downloading much easier.  I am really satisfied with this improvement.  Cons I noticed were the lack of an camera flash and fingerprint Id scanner.  I am using the iPad air right this minute to right this review and it has caught me surprise even though u did my research on the table before purchasing it two weeks before.

Reviews.Title: Perfect

Reviews.Title: o.k.

Reviews.Content: It's GREAT but I had to have a few people HELP me getting it started, as this is my 1st one and and they don't send you a user paper to tell you anything.... and old folks need a little something to follow along with, if i had a smart phone, they said it's about like that to set up....

Reviews.Title: Versatile, fast and intuitive!
Reviews.Author: kim joseph
Reviews.Content: Love it!  It is faster and lighter, then the IPAD. I like it so much, especially for reading and for studying my music.

Reviews.Title: Looks great; met all our expectations.
Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are both familiar with Apple products, but this is the first iPad we've ever owned. Because I'm not a tablet guru or anything (nor was I particularly concerned with the improvements between revisions), I can really only review the product from the simplest perspective: does the product meet my particular needs?My answer is definitely yes. As our first tablet, we were mainly looking for a mobile media hub that also can perform various utilities that we find important (finances, travel guides, recipes in the kitchen, ebook reading). The iPad covers all of those bases nicely, and it's all packaged in a very sleek, attractive design.My primary reason for purchasing this particular model is that I plan on this lasting as long as possible, and I was concerned that an older model would become functionally obsolete faster than a newer model.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Ginger
Reviews.Content: The iPad Air is as great and better than it looks on the Apple website or commercials.  I had the mini and traded up for the Air.  I made a great decision and no one can come close to competing with Apple.  (Just my opinion).  I love my MAC, iPhone and iPad Air.

Reviews.Title: stopped working within 2 months of buying
Reviews.Author: Sohaib Aleem
Reviews.Content: for no obvious reason (no spills no voltage issues with other electronic appliances) stopped working. Headache not worth the investment and brand recognition

Reviews.Title: Fragile
Reviews.Author: Greg Brown
Reviews.Content: Nice device, but very fragile. I've had mine for about 6 months and the screen cracked for no apparent reason. Apple won't fix it - they will only replace it for $300 (on top of the $700 I already spent on it). No thanks.

Reviews.Title: Waited for 5 gens for this gem
Reviews.Author: David Werble "davidwerble"
Reviews.Content: Even with the case it is light. More importantly it is FAST. I didn't really need the AT&T; hook up (haven;t bought it yet) so unless you are a traveler finding no WiFi I'd go with WiFI only and save some $$$$.

Reviews.Title: Good entertainment tablet
Reviews.Author: A. Kim
Reviews.Content: I have recently transitioned from PC/Android so I am still learning the rope but my overall experience have been very good.  Initial set up was breeze, Retina screen is pleasure to see, lighter weight means less stress on my wrist from extended use.However there was one issue where I thought people who are thinking of switching from Android tablet to iPad should consider carefully first.iPad has no file system like Android tablet so simple cut and paste file/folder transfer will not work.  Google it first with "How do you transfer multiple folders to iPad?" and read what others have said.  You can download third party software that will allow you transfer individual folder content at a time but that is tedious and time consuming if you one to transfer whole bunch of folders at once.If you can swallow the price and the above mentioned "issue", then I whole heartedly recommend iPad over Android tablet.

Reviews.Title: Air or mini, cellular or wifi? The hardest choice.
Reviews.Author: Mumbly Joe "MumblyJoe"
Reviews.Content: A lot of people have already talked about the merits of this device and the pros and cons. For me the decision wasn't so much which to buy but rather which one I wanted. Originally I got the mini to replace my kindle touch because of the price and the pocketable size. Ultimately I ended up with the air. Here's why:Grip: despite the very comfortable dimensions for 1 handed holding of the mini the extra thin bezel proved problematic. The palm rejection tech is supposed to be quite good but I found it unreliable and for those times I wanted to gets.  Eventually I always wanted to get a hold of it with  the bezel between my thumb and forefinger but either ended up with a thumb right in the middle of whatever I was watching or a hand cramp.Real estate: getting smaller means text is smaller especially on we pages In portrait mode. You can set the text size up for dynamic type but it doesn't work everywhere and when if does work and you change to landscape, then the text is far too big for the screen. Furthermore, in games where part of the screen is used for the controls I ended up wishing for a larger screen.Keyboard: the keyboard ended up being the main reason I went for the Air. While it is surprisingly good on the mini (really it blew me away how good the keyboard was in the mini) typing at that size for any extended period is taxing and it just can't compete with the Air if you plan on writing any amount. Furthermore, using the GarageBand keyboards are fairly awkward on the smaller screen. Unlike the accessory keyboards for the full size iPads, I found the external keyboards for the mini were actually much much worse than the onscreen keyboard.Pocketability: the mini fit quite nicely into a jacket pocket, in the climate where I live jackets are only really feasible about 3 or 4 months out of the year. Other than that it needs bag of some sort, which is really the same situation I'd be in with an Air.Weight: this made the choice the hardest. Holding the iPad mini feels like hardly anything at all. The iPad air feels considerably heavier. That affects everything you do with the tablet and the entire interaction with it. Fortunately it's mostly a matter of perspective. Put down the mini for a day and all of a sudden the air seems  quite light.For me the decision was made for the larger version but what about options?Cellular of no cellular? The free 3G on my kindle touch has gotten me out of a scrape more than once and having access to a no-strings-attached internet connection is guaranteed to come in handy at least once during the lifetime of your tablet. $130 is a lot to spend though, especially if you have a smart phone and free tethering on your plan. Originally I went for the wifi version for precisely this reason. However, the ability to tether is dependent on the carrier you happen to be using. Should you switch phones, carriers or plans or simply lose the phone while traveling tethering May no longer be a option and it's never going to be as convenient as simply opening the settings on your iPad and activating a plan. In addition you also gain the ability to use gps with a cellular modem and gain the benefits of enhanced find my iPhone accuracy in the event that it's stolen and the thieves know enough to keep it off wifi. Finally though, the possibility of a free 200 mb per month with t-mobile and the ability to switch carriers at will ended up pushing me to get the cellular version.So, after having initially been interested by the mini, a lot  of research, even more indecision and having bought, lived with and sold multiple versions of this thing I can safely say that the iPad Air with cellular is the  version I'd pick. If you don't plan on typing a lot with it though or watching movies, go for the mini.

Reviews.Title: First Ever Apple Product - First Ever iPad - LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: JoHarley
Reviews.Content: The has become a great tool for my photography needs. I got it around mid November so I haven’t had it that long. I've been tired of carrying a laptop when going on a trip which I used to download daily the photos taken that day. Thought I’d give the iPad a try.Pros:- It’s super light in weight which makes it ideal for carrying.- It’s fast. Apps run very nicely.- Great camera and photo tools.- Beautiful screen! Photos look super nice on display.Cons:- BIG, BIG CON! You can’t connect an external, off the shelf, drive to it for backing up my photos. Ended up spending twice the money for the Seagate Wireless Plus, 1 TB. It took a bit of setting up but it does do the job. BUT STILL! Why on earth can’t I simply connect a $70 one TB drive to the unit?? Seems a bit petty to me.- Connectors costs a bundle! I needed an SD card reader, an HDMI connector for streaming video to TVs in hotels, and a Micro SD connector  for my smart phone and other devices. The HDMI connector itself was $50.00. This thing probably cost $0.50 to make, but I WAS warned  about Apple’s marketing tactics…- The manual leaves a bit to be desired. I’ve learned more from friends then I have from their manual. Ended up with the book “My iPad” for Que. Good book…Still got some learning to do with this device but it has been fun to figure out. And for photography work, it’s going to be nice to have.

Reviews.Title: Safari Crashes Constantly
Reviews.Author: Philly Music
Reviews.Content: As a MacBook Pro user and Apple supporter, I'm surprised and very disappointed that Safari on my brand-new iPad Air 16G crashes constantly.  It's obviously a known issue, as the discussion boards are filled with similar reports.  This could not have been missed during product testing. Inexcusable.

Reviews.Title: Padman
Reviews.Author: Joe Consumer
Reviews.Content: Lighter by far.  I love the large screen, but till now would find myself using the iPad Mini most of the time.  The iPad Air is light and comfortable to hold. The Mini is now the backup as I love the Air.  Speed increase, overall case size reduction, and weight reduction are all solid reasons for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Love!

Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband for Christmas. He loves it. Takes it everywhere. No crashing issues with the OS like on his Iphone. Screen is amazing. Pictures and video come out great. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Content: After a couple of weeks, I stumbled onto the manual (using my macbook). After a few hours, I figured out how to locate it and  load it on the iPad. Now, I'm trying to figure out why it wasn't pre-loaded. I'm sure there's a good reason that will come to me shortly.

Reviews.Content: Waited years before purchasing, read dozens of reviews, tried other manufacturers' products, and listened to others' opinions.Apple is at, or near, the top of their game obviously.Design, tooling, functionality, aesthetics, all of it really, are on the mark. Throw in the "it" factor and this is what you get.

Reviews.Title: What you've come to expect from Apple
Reviews.Author: jerome hammond
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from the original iPad, which was still in top working condition and being used daily. The product arrived earlier than expected in perfect condition. I've been using it now for 24 hours and my assessment is that it's exactly what we've come to expect from Apple - a product that feels great in the hand, looks great to the eye, and operates exactly as the mind would have created it. I look forward to 3 more years of trouble-free use from this outstanding Apple product.

Reviews.Title: They were who we though they were
Reviews.Author: Scott Crabtree
Reviews.Content: This is one of the pricier tablets, but I never have any problems with it.  The picture is great on it, and there's a ton of apps.  One gripe is having to download a browser that can handle flash.  That is just nitpicking at this point.  I mostly use it for netflix, hulu, xfinity streaming, and surfing the internet.  It is everything I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my wife
Reviews.Author: Mike Lockridge
Reviews.Content: My wife is really enjoying her Ipad Air.  She likes the size to watch her videos.  She enjoys playing her games on it anywhere she goes.  Also the picture is the best we have ever seen and we have seen quite a few desktop monitors, laptops, phones and tablets.

Reviews.Title: IPAD AIR
